title: Induced emf - loop moving through magnetic field

content.prompt: A lightbulb attached to a closed, conducting wire loop moves at a constant speed from Point A to Point B through a uniform magnetic field directed into the page, as shown. Which of the following correctly describes the behavior of the lightbulb as the loop moves from Point A to Point B, and provides the correct justification?

choices.label: The lightbulb will be lit because a current is induced in the wire loop as it moves through the magnetic field.
The lightbulb will be lit because the magnetic flux in the wire loop changes as the loop moves through the magnetic field.
The lightbulb will not light because the plane of the loop is perpendicular to the magnetic field, so no current is induced in the loop.
The lightbulb will not light because there is no change in the magnetic flux through the wire loop as it moves between the two points.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
